text: " I do not know what your opinion may be , Mrs. Weston , " said Mr. Knightley , " of this great intimacy between Emma and Harriet Smith , but I think it a bad thing .
text_tokenized: " I do not know what your opinion may be , Mrs. Weston , " said Mr. Knightley , " of this great intimacy between Emma and Harriet Smith , but I think it a bad thing .

text: " " A bad thing !
text_tokenized: " " A bad thing !

text: Do you really think it a bad thing?--why so ? "
text_tokenized: Do you really think it a bad thing?--why so ? "

text: " I think they will neither of them do the other any good . " "
text_tokenized: " I think they will neither of them do the other any good . " "

text: You surprize me !
text_tokenized: You surprize me !

text: Emma must do Harriet good : and by supplying her with a new object of interest , Harriet may be said to do Emma good . I have been seeing their intimacy with the greatest pleasure . How very differently we feel!--Not think they will do each other any good ! This will certainly be the beginning of one of our quarrels about Emma , Mr. Knightley . " " Perhaps you think I am come on purpose to quarrel with you , knowing Weston to be out , and that you must still fight your own battle . " " Mr. Weston would undoubtedly support me , if he were here , for he thinks exactly as I do on the subject . We were speaking of it only yesterday , and agreeing how fortunate it was for Emma , that there should be such a girl in Highbury for her to associate with . Mr. Knightley , I shall not allow you to be a fair judge in this case . You are so much used to live alone , that you do not know the value of a companion ; and , perhaps no man can be a good judge of the comfort a woman feels in the society of one of her own sex , after being used to it all her life . I can imagine your objection to Harriet Smith . She is not the superior young woman which Emma 's friend ought to be . But on the other hand , as Emma wants to see her better informed , it will be an inducement to her to read more herself .
text_tokenized: Emma must do Harriet good : and by supplying her with a new object of interest , Harriet may be said to do Emma good . I have been seeing their intimacy with the greatest pleasure . How very differently we feel!--Not think they will do each other any good ! This will certainly be the beginning of one of our quarrels about Emma , Mr. Knightley . Mr. Knightley , I shall not allow you to be a fair judge in this case . You are so much used to live alone , that you do not know the value of a companion ; and , perhaps no man can be a good judge of the comfort a woman feels in the society of one of her own sex , after being used to it all her life . I can imagine your objection to Harriet Smith . She is not the superior young woman which Emma 's friend ought to be . But on the other hand , as Emma wants to see her better informed , it will be an inducement to her to read more herself .

text: They will
text_tokenized: They will

text: read together .
text_tokenized: read together .

text: She means it , I know . "
text_tokenized: She means it , I know . "

text: " Emma has been meaning to read more ever since she was twelve years old .
text_tokenized: " Emma has been meaning to read more ever since she was twelve years old .

text: I have seen a great many lists of her drawing - up at various times of books that she meant to read regularly through -- and very good lists they were -- very well chosen , and very neatly arranged -- sometimes alphabetically , and sometimes by some other rule . The list she drew up when only fourteen -- I remember thinking it did her judgment so much credit , that I preserved it some time ; and I dare say she may have made out a very good list now . But I have done with expecting any course of steady reading from Emma .
text_tokenized: I have seen a great many lists of her drawing - up at various times of books that she meant to read regularly through -- and very good lists they were -- very well chosen , and very neatly arranged -- sometimes alphabetically , and sometimes by some other rule . The list she drew up when only fourteen -- I remember thinking it did her judgment so much credit , that I preserved it some time ; and I dare say she may have made out a very good list now . But I have done with expecting any course of steady reading from Emma .

text: She will never submit to any thing requiring industry and patience , and a subjection of the fancy to the understanding . Where Miss Taylor failed to stimulate , I may safely affirm that Harriet Smith will do nothing.--You never could persuade her to read half so much as you wished.--You know you could not . " "
text_tokenized: She will never submit to any thing requiring industry and patience , and a subjection of the fancy to the understanding . Where Miss Taylor failed to stimulate , I may safely affirm that Harriet Smith will do nothing.--You never could persuade her to read half so much as you wished.--You know you could not . " "

text: I dare say , " replied Mrs. Weston , smiling , " that I thought so _ then_;--but since we have parted , I can never remember Emma 's omitting to do any thing I wished .
text_tokenized: I dare say , " replied Mrs. Weston , smiling , " that I thought so _ then_;--but since we have parted , I can never remember Emma 's omitting to do any thing I wished .

text: " There is hardly any desiring to refresh such a memory as _ that_,"--said Mr. Knightley , feelingly ; and for a moment or two he had done .
text_tokenized: " There is hardly any desiring to refresh such a memory as _ that_,"--said Mr. Knightley , feelingly ; and for a moment or two he had done .

text: " But I , " he soon added , " who have had no such charm thrown over my senses , must still see , hear , and remember .
text_tokenized: " But I , " he soon added , " who have had no such charm thrown over my senses , must still see , hear , and remember .

text: Emma is spoiled by being the cleverest of her family . At ten years old , she had the misfortune of being able to answer questions which puzzled her sister at seventeen .
text_tokenized: Emma is spoiled by being the cleverest of her family . At ten years old , she had the misfortune of being able to answer questions which puzzled her sister at seventeen .

text: She was always quick and assured : Isabella slow and diffident . And ever since she was twelve , Emma has been mistress of the house and of you all . In her mother she lost the only person able to cope with her .
text_tokenized: She was always quick and assured : Isabella slow and diffident . And ever since she was twelve , Emma has been mistress of the house and of you all . In her mother she lost the only person able to cope with her .

text: She inherits her mother 's talents , and must have been under subjection to her .
text_tokenized: She inherits her mother 's talents , and must have been under subjection to her .

text: " " I should have been sorry , Mr. Knightley , to be dependent on _ your _ recommendation , had I quitted Mr. Woodhouse 's family and wanted another situation ; I do not think you would have spoken a good word for me to any body . I am sure you always thought me unfit for the office I held . " " Yes , " said he , smiling . " You are better placed _ here _ ; very fit for a wife , but not at all for a governess . But you were preparing yourself to be an excellent wife all the time you were at Hartfield .
text_tokenized: " " I should have been sorry , Mr. Knightley , to be dependent on _ your _ recommendation , had I quitted Mr. Woodhouse 's family and wanted another situation ; I do not think you would have spoken a good word for me to any body . I am sure you always thought me unfit for the office I held . " " Yes , " said he , smiling . " You are better placed _ here _ ; very fit for a wife , but not at all for a governess . But you were preparing yourself to be an excellent wife all the time you were at Hartfield .

text: You might not give Emma such a complete education as your powers would seem to promise ; but you were receiving a very good education from _ her _ , on the very material matrimonial point of submitting your own will , and doing as you were bid ; and if Weston had asked me to recommend him a wife , I should certainly have named Miss Taylor .
text_tokenized: You might not give Emma such a complete education as your powers would seem to promise ; but you were receiving a very good education from _ her _ , on the very material matrimonial point of submitting your own will , and doing as you were bid ; and if Weston had asked me to recommend him a wife , I should certainly have named Miss Taylor .

text: " Thank you . There will be very little merit in making a good wife to such a man as Mr. Weston . " " Why , to own the truth , I am afraid you are rather thrown away , and that with every disposition to bear , there will be nothing to be borne .
text_tokenized: " Thank you . There will be very little merit in making a good wife to such a man as Mr. Weston . " " Why , to own the truth , I am afraid you are rather thrown away , and that with every disposition to bear , there will be nothing to be borne .

text: We will not despair , however .
text_tokenized: We will not despair , however .

text: Weston may grow cross from the wantonness of comfort , or his son may plague him .
text_tokenized: Weston may grow cross from the wantonness of comfort , or his son may plague him .

text: " " I hope not _ that_.--It is not likely . No , Mr. Knightley , do not foretell vexation from that quarter . " "
text_tokenized: " " I hope not _ that_.--It is not likely . No , Mr. Knightley , do not foretell vexation from that quarter . " "

text: Not I , indeed .
text_tokenized: Not I , indeed .

text: I only name possibilities .
text_tokenized: I only name possibilities .

text: I do not pretend to Emma 's genius for foretelling and guessing .
text_tokenized: I do not pretend to Emma 's genius for foretelling and guessing .

text: I hope , with all my heart , the young man may be a Weston in merit , and a Churchill in fortune.--But Harriet Smith -- I have not half done about Harriet Smith .
text_tokenized: I hope , with all my heart , the young man may be a Weston in merit , and a Churchill in fortune.--But Harriet Smith -- I have not half done about Harriet Smith .

text: I think her the very worst sort of companion that Emma could possibly have .
text_tokenized: I think her the very worst sort of companion that Emma could possibly have .

text: She knows nothing herself , and looks upon Emma as knowing every thing .
text_tokenized: She knows nothing herself , and looks upon Emma as knowing every thing .

text: She is a flatterer in all her ways ; and so much the worse , because undesigned .
text_tokenized: She is a flatterer in all her ways ; and so much the worse , because undesigned .

text: Her ignorance is hourly flattery .
text_tokenized: Her ignorance is hourly flattery .

text: How can Emma imagine she has any thing to learn herself , while Harriet is presenting such a delightful inferiority ?
text_tokenized: How can Emma imagine she has any thing to learn herself , while Harriet is presenting such a delightful inferiority ?

text: And as for Harriet , I will venture to say that _ she _ can not gain by the acquaintance .
text_tokenized: And as for Harriet , I will venture to say that _ she _ can not gain by the acquaintance .

text: Hartfield will only put her out of conceit with all the other places she belongs to .
text_tokenized: Hartfield will only put her out of conceit with all the other places she belongs to .

text: She will grow just refined enough to be uncomfortable with those among whom birth and circumstances have placed her home .
text_tokenized: She will grow just refined enough to be uncomfortable with those among whom birth and circumstances have placed her home .

text: I am much mistaken if Emma 's doctrines give any strength of mind , or tend at all to make a girl adapt herself rationally to the varieties of her situation in life.--They only give a little polish .
text_tokenized: I am much mistaken if Emma 's doctrines give any strength of mind , or tend at all to make a girl adapt herself rationally to the varieties of her situation in life.--They only give a little polish .

text: " " I either depend more upon Emma 's good sense than you do , or am more anxious for her present comfort ; for I can not lament the acquaintance .
text_tokenized: " " I either depend more upon Emma 's good sense than you do , or am more anxious for her present comfort ; for I can not lament the acquaintance .

text: How well she looked last night !
text_tokenized: How well she looked last night !

text: " Oh !
text_tokenized: " Oh !

text: you would rather talk of her person than her mind , would you ?
text_tokenized: you would rather talk of her person than her mind , would you ?

text: Very well ; I shall not attempt to deny Emma 's being pretty . " " Pretty !
text_tokenized: Very well ; I shall not attempt to deny Emma 's being pretty . " " Pretty !

text: say beautiful rather .
text_tokenized: say beautiful rather .

text: Can you imagine any thing nearer perfect beauty than Emma altogether -- face and figure ?
text_tokenized: Can you imagine any thing nearer perfect beauty than Emma altogether -- face and figure ?

text: " I do not know what I could imagine , but I confess that I have seldom seen a face or figure more pleasing to me than hers .
text_tokenized: " I do not know what I could imagine , but I confess that I have seldom seen a face or figure more pleasing to me than hers .

text: But I am a partial old friend . " " Such an eye!--the true hazle eye -- and so brilliant !
text_tokenized: But I am a partial old friend . " " Such an eye!--the true hazle eye -- and so brilliant !

text: regular features , open countenance , with a complexion !
text_tokenized: regular features , open countenance , with a complexion !

text: oh !
text_tokenized: oh !

text: what a bloom of full health , and such a pretty height and size ; such a firm and upright figure !
text_tokenized: what a bloom of full health , and such a pretty height and size ; such a firm and upright figure !

text: There is health , not merely in her bloom , but in her air , her head , her glance .
text_tokenized: There is health , not merely in her bloom , but in her air , her head , her glance .

text: One hears sometimes of a child being ` the picture of health ; ' now , Emma always gives me the idea of being the complete picture of grown - up health .
text_tokenized: One hears sometimes of a child being ` the picture of health ; ' now , Emma always gives me the idea of being the complete picture of grown - up health .

text: She is loveliness itself .
text_tokenized: She is loveliness itself .

text: Mr. Knightley , is not she ?
text_tokenized: Mr. Knightley , is not she ?

text: " " I have not a fault to find with her person , " he replied . "
text_tokenized: " " I have not a fault to find with her person , " he replied . "

text: I think her all you describe .
text_tokenized: I think her all you describe .

text: I love to look at her ; and I will add this praise , that I do not think her personally vain .
text_tokenized: I love to look at her ; and I will add this praise , that I do not think her personally vain .

text: Considering how very handsome she is , she appears to be little occupied with it ; her vanity lies another way .
text_tokenized: Considering how very handsome she is , she appears to be little occupied with it ; her vanity lies another way .

text: Mrs. Weston , I am not to be talked out of my dislike of Harriet Smith , or my dread of its doing them both harm .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Weston , I am not to be talked out of my dislike of Harriet Smith , or my dread of its doing them both harm .

text: " " And I , Mr. Knightley , am equally stout in my confidence of its not doing them any harm .
text_tokenized: " " And I , Mr. Knightley , am equally stout in my confidence of its not doing them any harm .

text: With all dear Emma 's little faults , she is an excellent creature . Where shall we see a better daughter , or a kinder sister , or a truer friend ? No , no ; she has qualities which may be trusted ; she will never lead any one really wrong ; she will make no lasting blunder ; where Emma errs once , she is in the right a hundred times . " " Very well ; I will not plague you any more .
text_tokenized: With all dear Emma 's little faults , she is an excellent creature . Where shall we see a better daughter , or a kinder sister , or a truer friend ? No , no ; she has qualities which may be trusted ; she will never lead any one really wrong ; she will make no lasting blunder ; where Emma errs once , she is in the right a hundred times . " " Very well ; I will not plague you any more .

text: Emma shall be an angel , and I will keep my spleen to myself till Christmas brings John and Isabella . John loves Emma with a reasonable and therefore not a blind affection , and Isabella always thinks as he does ; except when he is not quite frightened enough about the children .
text_tokenized: Emma shall be an angel , and I will keep my spleen to myself till Christmas brings John and Isabella . John loves Emma with a reasonable and therefore not a blind affection , and Isabella always thinks as he does ; except when he is not quite frightened enough about the children .

text: I am sure of having their opinions with me .
text_tokenized: I am sure of having their opinions with me .

text: " I know that you all love her really too well to be unjust or unkind ; but excuse me , Mr. Knightley , if I take the liberty ( I consider myself , you know , as having somewhat of the privilege of speech that Emma 's mother might have had ) the liberty of hinting that I do not think any possible good can arise from Harriet Smith 's intimacy being made a matter of much discussion among you .
text_tokenized: " I know that you all love her really too well to be unjust or unkind ; but excuse me , Mr. Knightley , if I take the liberty ( I consider myself , you know , as having somewhat of the privilege of speech that Emma 's mother might have had ) the liberty of hinting that I do not think any possible good can arise from Harriet Smith 's intimacy being made a matter of much discussion among you .

text: Pray excuse me ; but supposing any little inconvenience may be apprehended from the intimacy , it can not be expected that Emma , accountable to nobody but her father , who perfectly approves the acquaintance , should put an end to it , so long as it is a source of pleasure to herself . It has been so many years my province to give advice , that you can not be surprized , Mr. Knightley , at this little remains of office .
text_tokenized: Pray excuse me ; but supposing any little inconvenience may be apprehended from the intimacy , it can not be expected that Emma , accountable to nobody but her father , who perfectly approves the acquaintance , should put an end to it , so long as it is a source of pleasure to herself . It has been so many years my province to give advice , that you can not be surprized , Mr. Knightley , at this little remains of office .

text: " " Not at all , " cried he ; " I am much obliged to you for it .
text_tokenized: " " Not at all , " cried he ; " I am much obliged to you for it .

text: It is very good advice , and it shall have a better fate than your advice has often found ; for it shall be attended to .
text_tokenized: It is very good advice , and it shall have a better fate than your advice has often found ; for it shall be attended to .

text: " Mrs. John Knightley is easily alarmed , and might be made unhappy about her sister .
text_tokenized: " Mrs. John Knightley is easily alarmed , and might be made unhappy about her sister .

text: " " Be satisfied , " said he , " I will not raise any outcry .
text_tokenized: " " Be satisfied , " said he , " I will not raise any outcry .

text: I will keep my ill - humour to myself . I have a very sincere interest in Emma .
text_tokenized: I will keep my ill - humour to myself . I have a very sincere interest in Emma .

text: Isabella does not seem more my sister ; has never excited a greater interest ; perhaps hardly so great .
text_tokenized: Isabella does not seem more my sister ; has never excited a greater interest ; perhaps hardly so great .

text: There is an anxiety , a curiosity in what one feels for Emma .
text_tokenized: There is an anxiety , a curiosity in what one feels for Emma .

text: I wonder what will become of her ! " " So do I , " said Mrs. Weston gently , " very much . " " She always declares she will never marry , which , of course , means just nothing at all . But I have no idea that she has yet ever seen a man she cared for .
text_tokenized: I wonder what will become of her ! " " So do I , " said Mrs. Weston gently , " very much . " " She always declares she will never marry , which , of course , means just nothing at all . But I have no idea that she has yet ever seen a man she cared for .

text: It would not be a bad thing for her to be very much in love with a proper object .
text_tokenized: It would not be a bad thing for her to be very much in love with a proper object .

text: I should like to see Emma in love , and in some doubt of a return ; it would do her good . But there is nobody hereabouts to attach her ; and she goes so seldom from home . " " There does , indeed , seem as little to tempt her to break her resolution at present , " said Mrs. Weston , " as can well be ; and while she is so happy at Hartfield , I can not wish her to be forming any attachment which would be creating such difficulties on poor Mr. Woodhouse 's account .
text_tokenized: I should like to see Emma in love , and in some doubt of a return ; it would do her good . But there is nobody hereabouts to attach her ; and she goes so seldom from home . " " There does , indeed , seem as little to tempt her to break her resolution at present , " said Mrs. Weston , " as can well be ; and while she is so happy at Hartfield , I can not wish her to be forming any attachment which would be creating such difficulties on poor Mr. Woodhouse 's account .

text: I do not recommend matrimony at present to Emma , though I mean no slight to the state
text_tokenized: I do not recommend matrimony at present to Emma , though I mean no slight to the state

text: , I assure you . " Part of her meaning was to conceal some favourite thoughts of her own and Mr. Weston 's on the subject , as much as possible .

text: There were wishes at Randalls respecting Emma 's destiny , but it was not desirable to have them suspected ; and the quiet transition which Mr. Knightley soon afterwards made to " What does Weston think of the weather ; shall we have rain ? " convinced her that he had nothing more to say or surmise about Hartfield .
